hints_html: Split up the fraction into two parts. Then evaluate the sum as a sum of easy to evaluate integrals.
hints_latex:
Split up the fraction into two parts. Then evaluate the sum as a sum of
easy to evaluate integrals.
hints_raw: Split up the fraction into two parts. Then evaluate the sum as a sum of easy to evaluate integrals.
question: 1 (a)
sols_html:
As suggested by the hint, we have

\[\begin{aligned} \int\frac{x^{3}-2x}{\sqrt{x}} \, dx &= \int\frac{x^{3}}{\sqrt{x}}\, dx - \int\frac{2x}{\sqrt{x}}\, dx \\ &= \int x^{5/2} \, dx -2 \int x^{1/2} \, dx \\ &= \frac{2x^{7/2}}{7} - \frac{4x^{3/2}}{3} + C.\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
As suggested by the hint, we have

:<math> \begin{align} \int\frac{x^{3}-2x}{\sqrt{x}} \, dx &= \int\frac{x^{3}}{\sqrt{x}}\, dx - \int\frac{2x}{\sqrt{x}}\, dx \\
&= \int x^{5/2} \, dx -2 \int x^{1/2} \, dx \\
&= \frac{2x^{7/2}}{7} - \frac{4x^{3/2}}{3} + C.
\end{align} </math>
